citation.article-title: Paenibacillus glycanilyticus sp. nov., a novel species that degrades heteropolysaccharide produced by the cyanobacterium Nostoc commune.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus glycanilyticus sp. nov.
Paenibacillus glycanilyticus (gly.can.i.ly'ti.cus. N.L. n. glycanum glycan, a heteropolysaccharide; Gr. adj. lyticus dissolving; N.L. adj. glycanilyticus degrading heteropolysaccharide)
Cells are rod-shaped, 0.5-0.8 μm by 3.0-5.0 μm.
Gram-positive.
Cells are motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Ellipsoidal spores are formed in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are flat, smooth, circular, entire and pinkish yellow.
Catalase is produced.
Oxidase is not produced.
Facultatively aerobic.
Citrate, succinate, acetate, fumarate and malate are not utilized.
Growth occurs at pH 5.7.
There is no change in litmus milk.
Does not grow in the presence of 5% NaCl.
Optimal growth is obtained at 28-37°C.
No growth at 50°C.
The DNA G+C content is 50.5 mol%.
The major cellular fatty acid component is anteiso-C15:0.

The following carbon sources are assimilated: glycerol, L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, methyl β-D-xyloside, galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, rhamnose, inositol, mannitol, methyl α-D-mannoside, methyl α-D-glucoside, N-acetyl glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, D-raffinose, starch, glycogen, β-gentibiose, D-turanose and L-fucose.

The following carbon sources are not assimilated: erythritol, D-arabinose, L-xylose, adonitol, L-sorbose, dulcitol, sorbitol, inulin, xylitol, D-lyxose, D-tagatose, D-fucose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and 5-ketogluconate.
The type strain is strain DS-1T (=IFO 16618T=JCM 11221T=NRRL B-23455T), isolated from soil.
